learning_outcomes.description: Formulate and solve probabilistic problems in the framework of rigourous probability theory

assessments.task_description: You will be solving problems and justifying your solutions to those problems.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You are required to submit assessable items on time. If you fail to meet the submission deadline for any assessment item a penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark allocated for the assessment item (or equivalent penalty for other grading schemes) will be deducted per day for up to 7 calendar days, at which point any submission will not receive any marks unless an extension has been approved. Each 24-hour block is recorded from the time the submission is due.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Two-hour invigilated exam (specified material permitted)

Type: Exam – during Exam Period (Central)

Reading time: 10 minutes

Duration: 120 minutes

Description: The final examination in this course will be held during the end-of-semester examination period. It will be an in-person exam held on campus.

Materials Permitted: UQ Approved calculator, One double-sided A4 sheed of notes (handwritten or typed), bilingual dictionary

Criteria and marking: The exam is assessed on the accuracy and completeness of the results (are the answers correct, and is sufficient explanation given?). Additional assessment criteria may include the amount of innovative and mathematically elegant reasoning, and the clarity of exposition.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
